description: An ID card that once belonged to a scientist.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at one control panel, if you can find one.
An ID card that once belonged to a military officer.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at one control panel, if you can find one.
An ID card that once belonged to a high-level technician.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at one control panel, if you can find one.
A manually-encoded badge giving you access to the artisans' workshop.  It even has your name written on the back.

A visitor's pass to some sort of facility.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at a card reader, if you can find one.  It also lists the addresses of nearby facilities; activate it to add their locations to your map.

use_action.message: You add the facilities to your map.

description: An employee badge for a maintenance worker.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at green zone card readers.
An employee badge for a maintenance worker.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at ocher zone card readers.
An employee badge for a maintenance worker.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at blue zone card readers.

An employee badge for a freight hauler.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at transport freight card readers.  It also lists the addresses of nearby facilities; activate it to add their locations to your map.

use_action.message: You add the facilities to your map

description: An employee badge for a security officer.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at yellow zone card readers.

An employee badge for a security officer.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at black zone card readers.
An employee badge for a research scientist.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at light green zone card readers.
An employee badge for a research scientist.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at pink zone card readers.
An employee badge for a research scientist.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at cyan zone card readers.
An employee badge for a medical doctor.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access at red zone card readers.

description: An employee badge for a system's supervisor.  The reverse side describes the protocol for using it; this could grant access through white zone card readers.
An ID badge for the LIXA facility, with a photo of an awkwardly smiling scientist on the front.  Instructions on the back explain that this will grant you access to the LIXA experiment floor.
An ID badge for the LIXA facility, with a photo of an awkwardly smiling scientist on the front.  It is heavily scratched, and there is a line on the back in black marker.

description: An ID badge for the LIXA facility.  The photo is of a gently smiling older man, with kind eyes.
An id card bearing the name, rank, and serial number of a soldier stationed at LIXA.
A small rectangular device that Rubik gave you.  It is meant to be plugged in a locator antenna to reactivate it.
